FILE: cm365710v11.0.txt
DYAD: RUSSIA/USSR-CHINA
RIVALRY: RIV1010
DISPUTE(S): MID3245 MID3642 MID3247 MID104 MID3249 MID378 MID31 MID3250 MID2314 MID3645 MID3646 MID3647 MID3255 MID3254 MID3258 MID3256 MID2182 MID1142 MID2700 MID1143 MID3257 MID3259 MID1668 MID2208 MID1674 MID41 MID3655 MID3656 MID3263 MID3264 MID2703 MID2704 MID3265 MID2706 MID2707 MID2708 MID343 MID2709 MID2710 MID2711 MID349 MID2712 MID364 MID2713 MID2714 MID2715 MID3007 MID2716 MID2717 MID2718 MID4052 MID4104 

RIVNOTES: 

PS: 19009999-19520213 0.00 19520214-19630308 0.25 19630309-19971109 0.00 19971110-20041013 -9 20041014-20209999 0.5

PS-UPDATE2020: 

PS1800: 18620601-18999999 0.0

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220305
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220305

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

Pre-1900 MIDs: MID3245 MID3642 MID3247 MID104 MID3249 MID378

WWI MIDs: MID3258 MID3256 MID2182 MID1142 

WWII MIDs: MID3263 MID3264 

MID2703 

TERRMID: MID2703 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2703 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2703 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, in 1945 China demanded that the USSR turn Manchuria over to them to uphold the treaty ending WWII. USSR commanders landed in China in military aircraft, but this was to discuss Manchuria. COW seemingly coded this and a later movement of USSR troops as a show of force against China, but GML argue that no show of force took place and that these troop movements were part of the process of turning Manchuria over to the Chinese government. Coded territorial MID because China was claiming Manchuria and demanding it from USSR. Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped. 

TERRLINK: MID2703 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2703 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2703 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2703 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2703 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2703 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2703 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2703 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2703 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2703 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2703 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2703 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2703 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2703 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID31 

TERRMID: MID31 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID31 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID31 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID31 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID31 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID31 from cm narrative, this is one of two MIDs connected to the Boxer Rebellion. Conservative opponents of reform in China gave support to anti-foreign and anti-Christian secret societies. In 1900, Boxers attacked Christians throughout the countryside, leading to intervention by several Western/foreign powers and by Russia and Japan, who defeated China in a war. Russia is pulled in because they engaged rebels in response to the attacks. Coded civil war MID because Chinese support to secret groups militarized them and led to widespread violence against Russian interests, which then led to Russian intervention. 

CIVWARLINK: MID31 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID31 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID31 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID31 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3250 

TERRMID: MID3250 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3250 from Gibler 2018, in the wake of the Boxer Rebellion, Russia responded to threats to its interests in China by occupying Manchuria and intending to use it for Russia's economic gain. Russia had extensive railroads in Manchuria. Russia then demanded that China repay all of the damages caused by the rebels and China conceded, granting Russia sovereignty over a portion of Manchuria. Coded territorial MID because this involved Russia claiming and being granted sovereignty in Manchuria. 

TERRLINK: MID3250 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3250 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3250 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3250 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3250 from Gibler 2018, this was connected to the Boxer Rebellion. Militarized rebels destroyed a majority of Russia's railroads in Manchuria, leading to a dispute between China and Russia. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to militarized rebels in China. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3250 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3250 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3250 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3250 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2314 

TERRMID: MID2314 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2314 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2314 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, this is another MID connected to the Boxer Rebellion, in which Russia claimed Manchuria. Coded uncertain because GML argue this case should be combined with MID31 due to temporal overlap.

TERRLINK: MID2314 3 -- not third party link to territory
TERRLINK-CER: MID2314 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2314 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2314 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2314 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2314 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2314 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2314 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2314 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, this is another MID connected to the Boxer Rebellion. Like the previous MIDs, this involved Russia engaging with Chinese rebels on Chinese territory. However, this is coded uncertain because GML argue this MID should be combined with MID31. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2314 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2314 1 -- certain

MID3645 

TERRMID: MID3645 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3645 from Gibler 2018, in 1903 Russia demanded an expansion of the area they controlled in Manchuria, and refused to remove their troops from Manchuria until China agreed. China eventually conceded. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to Russia's claim on Manchuria. 

TERRLINK: MID3645 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3645 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3645 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3645 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3645 the Boxer Rebellion was over at this point, and there is no indication of continuing rebel activity. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3645 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain

COUPLINK-CER: MID3645 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3646 

TERRMID: MID3646 1 -- territorial MID 
TERRMID-CER: MID3646 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3646 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, the border between Russia and China was not demarcated clearly, and this led to tensions between the countries. In 1911, Russia became increasingly aggressive over the issue and fortified the border for over a year, triggering this MID. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a disputed border, and coded uncertain because GML argue this case should be combined with MID3647 due to temporal overlap. 

TERRLINK: MID3646 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3646 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3646 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3646 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3646 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3646 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3646 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3646 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3646 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3646 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3646 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3646 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3646 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3646 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3647 

TERRMID: MID3647 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3647 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3647 from Gibler 2018, in 1910-1911, the undemarcated border between Russia and China led to tensions between the governments. Russia increased its belligerence and fortified their border with China for over a year, triggering this MID. Russia demanded numerous other concessions from China and threatened military action if the demands were not met. China eventually conceded. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID3647 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3647 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3647 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3647 1 -- certain

MID3255 

TERRMID: MID3255 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3255 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3255 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3255 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3255 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3255 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3255 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3255 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3255 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3255 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3255 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, rebels in Mongolia declared independence from China, and China sought to crush the rebellion. Russia trained the rebels, but neither supported them in any other way in their rebellion against China nor permitted the rebels to have access to Russian territory. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to separatist rebels in China, but coded uncertain because GML argue this case should be dropped, since Russia's training of the rebels did not amount to Russian involvement in a MID against China. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3255 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3255 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3255 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3255 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3255 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3255 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3254 

TERRMID: MID3254 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3254 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3254 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3254 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3254 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3254 from Gibler 2018, China was still trying to prevent Mongolia from being independent, but Mongolian separatist rebels declared independence and attempted to set up a government. Russia wanted Mongolia to become independent; they recognized the Mongolian government, concluded a treaty with them, and fought against Chinese forces in Mongolia. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to separatist rebels in China. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3254 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3254 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3254 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3254 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2700 

TERRMID: MID2700 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2700 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2700 from Gibler 2018, Russia and China disputed China's right to navigation in the Amur, an inland river that forms part of the border between those countries. In 1919, China sailed up the Amur, and Russia fired at the ships. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a claim on the Amur, an inland river boundary that Russia claimed sovereignty over. 

TERRLINK: MID2700 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2700 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2700 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2700 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2700 This inland boundary did not concern maritime space.

ISLMID: MID2700 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2700 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2700 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2700 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

MID1143 

TERRMID: MID1143 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1143 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1143 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, there is insufficient information on this MID. COW says that this MID involves China seizing railroad property from Russia. GML argue this case is not supported by historical information, so this is coded uncertain.

MID3257 

TERRMID: MID3257 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3257 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3257 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3257 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3257 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3257 from Gibler 2018, Mongolian rebels declared independence, but China did not want to cede sovereignty to them. In 1921, separatist rebels set up a revolutionary congress. Russia supported their bid to take power in Mongolia and declare an official, functioning government. Soviet forces helped the rebels take the capital and fought against Chinese forces, triggering this MID. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to militarized rebels in Chinese territory (Mongolia). 

CIVWARLINK: MID3257 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3257 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3257 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3257 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3259 

TERRMID: MID3259 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3259 from Gibler 2018, after the Russian Civil War, China and Russia disputed an area along their border. In 1919, both countries engaged in a show of force near the disputed area, and China later occupied the disputed territory. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to disputed territory. 

TERRLINK: MID3259 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3259 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3259 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3259 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3259 from Gibler 2018, the disputed territory was also occupied by White Army Russians who fled Russia after the civil war. Russia sent troops to the area due to these rebels, although there does not seem to be any direct fighting between Russian forces and rebels. Coded civil war MID because this MID involved Russia deploying troops to the disputed area partially in response to militarized rebels there. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3259 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3259 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3259 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3259 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1668 

TERRMID: MID1668 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID1668 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID1668 from Gibler 2018, this dispute is over the Amur river, an inland river boundary. Russia had controlled it for a long time but China began to assert sovereignty over it. China allowed merchants to freely navigate the river, and Russia responded with barricades along the river, amounting to a border fortification. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a dispute over an inland river boundary. 

TERRLINK: MID1668 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1668 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1668 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1668 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1668 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1668 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID1668 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1668 1 -- certain

MID2208 

TERRMID: MID2208 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2208 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2208 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2208 from cm narrative, the Great Powers (Germany, Japan, France, UK, US, Italy, Russia) demanded that China remove mines it had placed in the Dagu Harbor, as that harbor provided access to a major Chinese river. Those countries jointly threatened China, triggering this MID. China exchanged naval fire with Japan as part of this incident. Coded not maritime because the maritime boundary was not being disputed between China and Russia.

ISLMID: MID2208 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2208 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2208 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2208 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2208 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID1674 

TERRMID: MID1674 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1674 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1674 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1674 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1674 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1674 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1674 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1674 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1674 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1674 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID1674 from Gibler 2018 and cm narrative, in 1927 China seized a Russian ship that they accused of carrying propaganda materials. This was connected to the ongoing Chinese civil war, and China sentenced the crew to death. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to the Chinese Civil War. 

CIVWARLINK: MID1674 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1674 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID1674 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID41 

TERRMID: MID41 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID41 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID41 from Gibler 2018, in 1929 China and Russia fought over control of railroads in Manchuria. This is the Sino-Soviet War. Coded not territory because this was connected to ownership of railroads, not sovereignty over territory, making this a financial issue. 

TERRLINK: MID41 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID41 1 -- certain

CIVWARMID: MID3655 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3655 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3655 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, several Chinese warlords were feuding during the Chiense Civil War, and one of them asked Russia to intervene on their side. The Soviets did become involved to some extent. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to the Chinese Civil War, but coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped as China did not protest Russia's involvement.

CIVWARLINK: MID3655 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3655 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3655 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3655 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3655 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3655 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3656 

TERRMID: MID3656 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3656 from Gibler 2018, this is during the Xinjiang Wars that were occurring in China. Russia backed rebels in the conflict and managed to take a piece of Chinese territory as a result. Coded territorial MID because this involved Russia taking territory away from China.

TERRLINK: MID3656 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3656 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3656 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3656 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3656 coded civil war MID because this was connected to the Xinjiang Wars, a seried of civil conflicts in China in which militarized rebels were fighting against China. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3656 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3656 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3656 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3656 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2704 

TERRMID: MID2704 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2704 Coded not territory because the USSR was not claiming Manchuria. It was using its presence there to leverage more favorable trade arrangements with China and to remove US influence in the area (Gibler 2018). USSR did not seek sovereignty over Manchuria.

TERRLINK: MID2704 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2704 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2704 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2704 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2704 from Gibler 2018, after WWII, China was still dealing with rebels in Manchuria and although the Soviets were still occupying Manchuria, they agreed with China that they would leave shortly after the war. However, the Soviets did not leave as soon as the Chinese wanted them to and admitted to supporting rebels in the region. China and Russia escalated tensions over both this and economic issues, and Russia threatened to stay in Manchuria. The longer-than-promised Soviet occupation of Manchuria (against China's wishes) and the threat to remain trigger this MID. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to militarized rebels in Manchuria. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2704 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2704 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2704 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2704 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3265 

TERRMID: MID3265 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3265 from Benson 1990, China was still claiming part of Mongolia after WWII, although Mongolia was recognized as an independent state. This therefore amounts to a territorial MID.

TERRLINK: MID3265 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3265 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3265 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3265 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID3265 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3265 from Gibler 2018, Russia backed several attacks on China by Mongolian forces that were still fighting for independence from China. Coded civil war link because this was connected to militarized rebels in Mongolia, outside this dyad. Mongolia had become an independent state after wWII, so this becomes a civwarlink (rebels in Mongolia, outside the dyad), as opposed to a civwar (rebels in Chinese territory). 

COUPMID: MID3265 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3265 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3265 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2706 

TERRMID: MID2706 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2706 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2706 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, there is no evidence that a MID occurred at all here. GML recommend this case be dropped,so coded uncertain. 

TERRLINK: MID2706 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2706 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID2706 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2706 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2706 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2707 

TERRMID: MID2707 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2707 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2707 from Gibler 2018, Mao accused the Soviets of amassing troops on their disputed border and planning to annex Chinese territory. Soviet Union accused China of border violations. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID2707 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2707 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2707 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2707 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID2707 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2707 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2707 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2707 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2707 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2707 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2707 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2708 

TERRMID: MID2708 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2708 from Gibler 2018, Soviet Union and China began amassing troops along their disputed border as their relations deteriorated, and China threatened to cut ties with the Soviet Union altogether. No fighting broke out, and the border build-up of troops triggers this MID. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to dipsuted territory. 

TERRLINK: MID2708 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2708 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2708 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain

CIVWARMID-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2708 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2708 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2708 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2708 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID343 

TERRMID: MID343 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID343 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID343 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID343 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID343 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID343 from Gibler 2018, China-Soviet Union relations were deteriorating. China's Cultural Revolution was frowned upon by the Soviet Union as a false version of a proletariat revolution. Chinese refugees poured across the border fleeing the Cultural Revolution, and this led to minor clashes between China and the Soviet Union. Coded not civil war because this was connected to refugees pouring across the border, and they were not militarized. 

CIVWARLINK: MID343 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID343 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID343 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID343 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2709 

TERRMID: MID2709 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2709 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2709 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2709 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2709 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2709 from cm narrative, MID2709 occurred from January 26th to February 12th, 1967. It seems to include several incidents: Chinese students beaten up in Moscow, followed by attacks on Soviet citizens in Beijing and an attack on the Chinese Embassy in Moscow during which 31 Chinese citizens, several of them diplomats, were injured. Coded not civil war because these eevents do not involve militarized rebels. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2709 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2709 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2709 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2709 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2710 

TERRMID: MID2710 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2710 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2710 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2710 from cm narrative, MID2710 occurred from August 10th to 17th, 1967. From Gibler 2018, China detained a USSR ship for violating trading rights. The captain of the ship was arrested and both the captain and crew were beaten up by the Chinese Red Guards. The Russian Prime Minister, Kosygin made a formal complaint to his Chinese counterpart. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to a maritime dispute; rather, it was connected to a trade dispute.

ISLMID: MID2710 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2710 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2710 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2710 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2710 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2710 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2711 

TERRMID: MID2711 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2711 from cm narrative, MID2711 occurred from August 1968 to September 28, 1968. From Gibler 2018, this MID involved USSR violating Chinese airspace and amassing troops along the border. From New York Times 9/17/1968 and 9/30/1968, China claimed that this was part of USSR's strategy of containing China in much the same way that the US was doing to China and USSR. Coded not territory because USSR was not making a territorial claim here.

TERRLINK: MID2711 3 -- not third party link to territory
TERRLINK-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2711 from cm narrative, MID2711 occurred from August 1968 to September 28, 1968. It seems to have taken place over the security threat under which the Chinese Embassy in Prague found itself and its members during the Prague Spring (Russian intervention in Czechoslovakia). China accused Russia of unlawfully infringing on the territory of the embassy and firing several shots over it. Coded not third party link to territorial MID because the Prague Spring is not a territorial dispute, but rather about Russian influence in Czechoslovakia. 

MARITMID: MID2711 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2711 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2711 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2711 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2711 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2711 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2711 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID349 

TERRMID: MID349 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID349 from Gibler 2018, the Damansky Island is located in the inland river boundary between China and USSR. Coded territorial MID because this is connected to a territorial boundary dispute, as control over the island has implications for the inland land boundary.

TERRLINK: MID349 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID349 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID349 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: MID349 from Gibler 2018 and cm narrative, this was connected to a dispute over Darnasky Island, located in an inland river boundary between China and SU. Fighting broke out between China and SU in 1969. Coded islands MID because this was connected to sovereignty over Darnasky island. 

CIVWARMID: MID349 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID349 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID349 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID349 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID349 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2712 

TERRMID: MID2712 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2712 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2712 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, the Soviet Union accused China of border violations, but it was later discovered that the Soviet Union likely fabricated the charge and there no evidence that border violations occurred. Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped.

TERRLINK: MID2712 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2712 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID-CER: MID2712 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID2712 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2712 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2712 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID2712 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2712 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2712 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID364 

TERRMID: MID364 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID364 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID364 from Gibler 2018, China detained a Soviet helicopter that landed in China and accused the Soviet Union of espionage, triggering this MID. The Soviet Union denied the accusations. Coded not territory because this was not connected to a territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID364 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID364 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID364 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID364 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID364 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID364 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID364 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID364 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID364 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID364 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID364 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2713 

TERRMID: MID2713 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2713 from Gibler 2018, the London Daily Telegraph reported that Chinese and Soviet troops clashed near their Mongolian border. Both countries denied the incident. From cm narrative, USSR and China were disputing control of Mongolia at this time (although Mongolia was an independent state). Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute over Mongolia.

TERRLINK: MID2713 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2713 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2713 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2713 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2713 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2713 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2713 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2713 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2714 

TERRMID: MID2714 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2714 from Gibler 2018, in 1977 Soviet spies crossed into China at the disputed border at Xinjiang and fought with a local Chinese militia, triggering this MID. Later, Soviet border guards crossed into Chinese territory and killed a villager. Coded territorial MID because per Huth and Allee 2002, the Xinjiang border was disputed at this time. 

TERRLINK: MID2714 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2714 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2714 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2714 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2714 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2714 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2714 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2714 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2715 

TERRMID: MID2715 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2715 from cm narrative, MID2715 occurred between March 11 and May 9, 1978, as China refused several proposals from the Soviet Union to solve the issues of their disputed border. Chinese officials also made threatening statements saying that China would win a war against the Soviet Union any time. A military incident occurred in the Wusuli/Ussuri disputed region. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID2715 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2715 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2715 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2715 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2715 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2715 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2715 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2715 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3007 

TERRMID: MID3007 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3007 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3007 from Gibler 2018 and cm narrative, this was connected to the Vietnamese War, a territorial dispute. The Soviet Union supported Vietnamese rebels, and this angered China because China suspected the Soviets of trying to encircle them in Asia. Soviet support for militarized rebels pulls them into this MID, and China is pulled in because they sent forces into Vietnam. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to the Vietnam War, a territorial dispute in Vietnam. 

MARITMID: MID3007 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3007 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3007 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3007 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3007 coded civil war link because this was connected to the Vietnam War, which had a civil war element because militarized rebels were fighting in the war. Vietnam is outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID3007 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3007 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3007 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2716 

TERRMID: MID2716 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2716 1 -- third party link to territorial MID 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2716 from Gibler 2018, China invaded Vietnam in 1979, and the Soviets responded by supporting Vietnam with money and weapons. Soviet troops also clashed with Chinese forces. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to China's invasion of Vietnam, a terriorial dispute in part (Zhang 2005). 

MARITMID: MID2716 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2716 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2716 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2716 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2716 coded civil war link because the Sino-Vietnam War (outside this dyad) also had a civil conflict element as guerillas were fighting in the conflict. Zhang (2005) also reports a connection between this war and the Cambodian civil war, with China trying to relieve Vietnamese pressure on the Khmer Rouge.

COUPMID: MID2716 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2716 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2716 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID2717 

TERRMID: MID2717 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID2717 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2717 from Gibler 2018, Soviet border guards crossed the disputed border and attacked villagers, prompting protest from China. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute.

MARITMID-NOTES: MID4052 from Gibler 2018, China seized a Russian trawler in 1993 because it suspected it of smuggling. Russia protested. Coded not maritime because this was not connected to a maritime dispute.

COUPLINK-CER: MID4052 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4104 

TERRMID: MID4104 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4104 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4104 from Gibler 2018, China opened fire on Russian fisherman near Chinese territorial waters. Russia protested. From Japanese Economic Newswire 6/16/1994, this occurred in an inland river boundary which was a disputed border and was connected to China asserting control over the disputed border. Coded territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute (inland river boundary).

TERRLINK: MID4104 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4104 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:
